p: The former European chief climate negotiator—Bert Metz—mentioned that China’s climate negotiators had even claimed that ‘China will always remain a developing country, and don’t expect us ever to be one Annex I country’ (Interview 2018). The North-South divide remained as the core of China’s understanding and construction of climate change. At the same time, China firmly rejected to represent itself as an international climate leader (Conrad 2012). In Copenhagen, China’s then Vice Foreign Minister He Yafei (2009) stressed that the so-called China-US co-leadership in climate governance has ‘no legal basis’ and ‘is far from the truth’ in reality.
